TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name/ Click the “Continue” button to start the experiment.
A 10 ml glass pipette and a pipette pump are taken from the rack.
The pipette is fixed carefully to the pipette pump.
10 ml of the Milk Sample-1 is then pipetted using the pipette.
A sterile screw cap tube is taken from the test tube rack.
The mouth of the tube is heat sterilized in the blue flame of the Bunsen burner.
After that the Milk Sample-1 taken in the pipette is transferred into the screw cap tube.
The mouth of the tube is again heat sterilized.
The screw cap tube with the milk sample is kept in the rack.
The used pipette is removed from the pipette pump.
The used pipette is then kept in the pipette rack. Another sterile pipette is taken from the rack.
The pipette is fixed carefully to the pipette pump.
10 ml of the Milk Sample-2 is then pipetted using the sterile pipette.
A sterile screw cap tube is taken from the test tube rack.
The mouth of the tube is heat sterilized in the blue flame of the Bunsen burner.
After that the Milk Sample-2 taken in the pipette is transferred into the new screw cap tube.
The mouth of the tube is again heat sterilized.
The screw cap tube with the milk sample is kept in the rack.
The used pipette is removed from the pipette pump.
The used pipette is then kept in the pipette rack.
A sterile Pasteur pipette is then taken from the rack.
1 ml of Methylene Blue solution is taken using the Pasteur pipette.
The screw cap tube containing Milk Sample-1 is taken from the test tube rack.
The mouth of the tube is then heat sterilized and 1ml of the Methylene blue solution taken in the Pasteur pipette is transferred to the milk sample.
The mouth of the tube is again heat sterilized in the blue flame of the Bunsen burner.
The Pasteur pipette is then kept in the rack.
The milk sample with Methylene blue indicator is then mixed well by shaking the tube as shown.
The tube with the solution is then kept in the rack.
The same Pasteur pipette is then taken from the rack.
1 ml of Methylene Blue solution is taken using the Pasteur pipette.
The screw cap tube containing Milk Sample-2 is taken from the test tube rack.
The mouth of the tube is heat sterilized in the blue flame of the Bunsen burner.
1ml of the Methylene blue solution taken in the Pasteur pipette is transferred to the milk sample.
The mouth of the tube is again heat sterilized in the blue flame of the Bunsen burner.
The Pasteur pipette is then kept in the rack.
The milk sample with Methylene blue indicator is then mixed well by shaking the tube as shown.
The tube with the solution is then kept in the rack. The test tube rack containing the solutions is taken from the LAF.
The solutions are then kept in the water bath.
The solutions in the tubes are kept undisturbed in the water bath at 37 o C for 30 minutes.
After 30 minutes the tubes containing the solutions are taken from the water bath.
The tubes are then kept in the rack. The screw cap tube containing the Milk Sample-1 is taken from the rack.
The solution is mixed well by shaking the tube as shown. The colour change happened to the solution is noted.
Since the solution in the tube labeled sample-1 change to white (rapid reduction of Methylene blue indicator) within 30 minutes indicates the milk sample tested is of very poor quality.
The screw cap tube containing the Milk Sample-2 is taken from the rack.
The solution is mixed well by shaking the tube as shown.
Since there is no visible colour change in the solution, it is kept in a separate rack.
The rack containing the Sample – 2 solution is taken from the LAF.
It is then kept in the water bath.
The Sample – 2 solution is kept undisturbed in the water bath for 37 o C for 30 minutes.
After 30 minutes the tube containing the solution is taken from the water bath.
The tube is then kept in the rack.
The solution is mixed well by shaking the tube as shown. The color change in the solution is noted.
Since the solution in the tube labeled sample 2 changes to white (reduction of Methylene blue indicator) within 60 minutes (1 hour) the milk sample tested is of poor quality.
Various results that one can expect while performing Methylene Blue Reductase Test is listed above.
